Caption: Fig. 1. DQNViz: (a) the Statistics view presents the overall training statistics with line charts and stacked area charts; (b) the Epoch view shows epoch-level statistics with pie charts and stacked bar charts; (c) the Trajectory view reveals the movement and reward patterns of the DQN agent in different episodes; (d) the Segment view reveals what the agent really sees from a selected segment.
Fig. 2. The Breakout game and the reinforcement learning problem.
Fig. 3. Left: the four stages of DQN: Predict, Act, Observe, and Learn; right: the overview of our framework to analyze and improve DQN models.
Table 1. Formalizing action/reward patterns with regular expressions.
Fig. 4. Different designs for the event sequence data from DQN.
Fig. 5. Clustering segments (segment length is 100) in epoch 120.
Fig. 6. Left: the DQN structure; right: Segment View: (a) bar charts view, (b) PCA view with lasso selections, (c) average screens with saliency maps.
Fig. 8. (a) Blending a state with its saliency map. (b,c,d) what the agent sees from the segment in the 1st, 2nd, and 4th row of Figure 6a.
Fig. 7. The Epoch (a, b) and Trajectory (c) view of Epoch 37.
Table 2. Statistics of random actions per epoch (averaged over 10 runs).
Fig. 9. (a, b) Result of Experiment 1, 2; (c, d) game screen at a2, a3; (e) ball trajectory for segment b2, the ball follows the loop A-B-C-D-C-B-A.
